claim: Recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season.

verified_evidence.quote: After vaccination, in both age groups, the two egg based vaccines generally reinforced the neutralizing antibody responses to egg adapted epitopes as evidenced by an increased trend in the proportion of participants with GMT egg cell titer ratio ≥4. In contrast, among RIV4 and ccIIV4 recipients, the proportion of participants with GMT egg cell titer ratio ≥4 was significantly lower, suggesting that non egg based vaccines induced a broader antibody response to both egg and cell propagated viruses.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears on page 5 of the document, with only minor differences in wording but identical factual content. The relevant passage is: 'After vaccination, in both age groups, the two egg based vaccines generally reinforced the neutralizing antibody responses to egg adapted epi to pes as evidenced by an increased trend in the proportion of participants with GMT egg cell titer ratio ≥4. In contrast, among RIV4 and ccIIV4 recipients, the proportion of participants with GMT egg cell titer ratio ≥4 was significantly lower, suggesting that non egg based vaccines induced a broader antibody response to both egg and cell propagated viruses.' This matches the quote to verify in all substantive details.. The quote directly supports the claim. It states that non-egg-based vaccines (including recombinant RIV4) induced a broader antibody response to both egg and cell propagated viruses, as opposed to egg-based vaccines, which reinforced a narrower, egg-adapted response. This broader response is relevant to the claim that recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season. The quote provides explicit comparative immunogenicity data supporting the claim.

In contrast, among RIV4 and ccIIV4 recipients, the proportion of participants with GMT egg cell titer ratio ≥4 was significantly lower, suggesting that non egg based vaccines induced a broader antibody response to both egg and cell propagated viruses.' This matches the quote to verify in all substantive details.
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly supports the claim. It states that non-egg-based vaccines (including recombinant RIV4) induced a broader antibody response to both egg and cell propagated viruses, as opposed to egg-based vaccines, which reinforced a narrower, egg-adapted response. This broader response is relevant to the claim that recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season. The quote provides explicit comparative immunogenicity data supporting the claim.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote directly compares the immune response profiles, showing that recombinant (and cell-based) vaccines avoid the narrow, egg-adapted response and instead induce broader immunity, which is relevant for cross-protection in mismatch seasons.

verified_evidence.quote: The potential of non egg based vaccines to mitigate the impact of prior egg based vaccination remains unclear. In this study, repeat vaccination with either RIV4 or ccIIV4 further improved antibody responses to circulating viruses compared to repeated egg based vaccination.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears in the document, though with minor formatting and word order differences due to OCR cleanup. The relevant passage is: 'The potential of non egg based vaccines to miti gate the impact of prior egg based a cci nation remains nclear In this study, repeat vaccination with either RIV4 or ccIIV4 further improved antibody responses to circulating iith d d tli itib d / ll ti RIV4 l h d...' This matches the quoted content in meaning and technical detail, specifically stating that repeat vaccination with recombinant (RIV4) or cell-based (ccIIV4) vaccines improved antibody responses to circulating viruses compared to repeated egg-based vaccination.. The quote directly supports the claim. It states that repeat vaccination with recombinant (RIV4) or cell-based (ccIIV4) vaccines 'further improved antibody responses to circulating viruses compared to repeated egg based vaccination.' This is explicit evidence that recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season, as it shows improved responses to circulating (potentially mismatched) viruses.

verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote provides direct evidence that recombinant (and cell-based) vaccines enhance immune responses to circulating (i.e., potentially mismatched) viruses, supporting the claim of broader and cross-protective immunity.

rejected_evidence.quote: In year 1, RIV4 induced higher neutralizing and total HA head binding antibodies to cell- A (H3 N2) virus than ccIIV4 and IIV4.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote shows that the recombinant vaccine (RIV4) generated a stronger immune response against the cell-propagated (i.e., circulating) H3N2 virus compared to both cell-based and egg-based vaccines, supporting the claim that recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response.

rejected_evidence.quote: RIV4 contains 3 times the amount of HA/dose/strain compared to IIV4 and ccIIV4 (15 µg HA/dose/strain). For A (H3 N2), RIV4 vaccination not only improved the quality of the functional neutralizing antibody response, it also significantly increased the quantity of the total A (H3 N2) cell HA head binding antibodies.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote highlights that the recombinant vaccine (RIV4) not only increases the amount but also the quality of antibodies against the cell-propagated (circulating) H3N2 virus, supporting the claim of a broader immune response.

rejected_evidence.quote: Comparing pre- and 1 month post vaccination, A (H3 N2) HA stalk binding antibodies were significantly boosted in ccIIV4-RIV4, RIV4-RIV4, IIV4-ccIIV4, and IIV4-RIV4 arms, while A (H1 N1) pdm09 HA stalk binding antibodies were also significantly boosted in ccIIV4-ccIIV4 and RIV4-ccIIV4 arms.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote demonstrates that recombinant vaccine regimens (including RIV4-RIV4 and IIV4-RIV4) significantly boost HA stalk antibodies, which are associated with broader and cross-protective immunity.
